meanings.definition: To design or construct (a product) with more complexity or features than necessary.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overengineer his Lego creations, adding too many pieces and making them too complicated.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, engineers overengineer products by adding unnecessary features that customers don't need.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to overengineer the sandwich by adding ten different types of cheese, which was a bit excessive.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overengineer her outfits, always wearing too many accessories and layers.
meanings.sent5: The architect's tendency to overengineer buildings led to structures that were overly complex and difficult to maintain.

meanings.definition: To plan or execute (a project) with excessive attention to detail or unnecessary complexity.
meanings.sent1: The team tends to overengineer their presentations, spending hours on unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overengineer a project, as it can lead to delays and increased costs.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to overengineer their science fair project by including unnecessary experiments that didn't add value.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overengineer her daily schedule, planning every minute with unnecessary tasks.
meanings.sent5: The manager's tendency to overengineer processes resulted in confusion among the team members.
